thread.title: Comedian Frank Skinner to helm weekly talk show for BBC iPlayer
thread.title_full: Comedian Frank Skinner to helm weekly talk show for BBC iPlayer

title: Comedian Frank Skinner to helm weekly talk show for BBC iPlayer
text:
Comedian Frank Skinner to helm weekly talk show for BBC iPlayer Comedian Frank Skinner to helm weekly talk show for BBC iPlayer Share 
Comedian Frank Skinner has likened his new weekly talk show on BBC iPlayer to “a toy shop”. 
Frank Skinner On Demand With… airs exclusively on BBC iPlayer from November 13 and will see the 58-year-old joined each week by a different celebrity guest to talk about the weird and wonderful programmes they are enjoying on the BBC’s streaming platform. 
“As a kid, I had a recurring dream that I was alone in the local toy shop and could help myself to anything I fancied. BBC iPlayer feels a bit like that dream,” Frank said. Frank Skinner (Ian West/PA) 
“But now I’m allowed to take a playmate, to show me the things they love that I might have missed. And everything they reach for tells me more and more about them. Come and join us in the best toy shop ever.” 
The West Bromwich-born comedian will hang out with his guest at a location where they regularly watch BBC iPlayer – whether that’s on a tour bus, in their make-up chair, in their garden on a sun lounger or in the car while waiting to pick the kids up from school. 
In the first episode, he will sit down for a chat with comedian Lee Mack. TV and radio presenter Zoe Ball is the guest for episode two and comedian Josh Widdicombe stars in the third instalment. Zoe Ball to appear on Frank Skinner’s show (Daniel Leal-Olivas/PA) 
Frank Skinner On Demand With… will also help viewers to find out more about hidden gems lurking around the BBC. The aim is to showcase all genres: from documentaries and comedy, to film, food, music and arts. Share article 
BBC iPlayer had a record-breaking year in 2014, with 3.5bn TV and radio programme requests across all devices. Promoted Stories
